required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: What is the Best Verbal Instruction for Contraction the Pelvic Floor Muscles?
clinical_study.official_title: What is the Best Verbal Instruction for Contraction the Pelvic Floor Muscles?

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to T to compare the effectiveness of producing a pelvic floor muscle contraction by different verbal instruction. Pelvic floor muscle contraction will be measured displacement of the pelvic floor when imaged on ultrasound.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study will examine pelvic floor muscle contraction following different verbal instructions. This is a cross-sectional exploratory study. Physical-therapy students will be recruited to complete a survey and non-invasive transabdominal ultrasound assessment.
A bladder filling protocol will be implemented to ensure subjects will have sufficient fluid in their bladders to allow clear ultrasound imaging. This protocol involved subjects consuming 600-750 ml of water in a 1 hr. period. The participants will be tested in a crook-lying supine position with a pillow under their heads for comfort.
The participants will be divided into 2 groups randomly. Both groups will be given three different verbal instructions to contract pelvic floor muscles. Each contraction will be performed 3 time with rests of 10 sec between contractions. While the first 2 contractions for each verbal instruction will be held for 3 sec. the last contraction will be held as long as the participant can conduct and the time of contraction will be measured as well. The pelvic floor contraction will be measured by assessing bladder displacement via diagnostic ultrasound.
To image the pelvic floor a 5 MHz curved linear array transducer (Mindray M5) will be placed in the transverse plane immediately suprapubically over the lower abdomen angled at 15-30 degrees from the vertical. An on screen caliper and measurement tool will be used to measure bladder displacement.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: 2 groups randomly divided. Both groups will be given three different verbal instructions to contract pelvic floor muscles.

primary_outcome.measure: urinary bladder displacement in millimeters during first verbal instruction
primary_outcome.description: bladder displacement will be measured via diagnostic ultrasound using the on screen caliper tool

primary_outcome.measure: urinary bladder displacement in millimeters during second verbal instruction
primary_outcome.description: bladder displacement will be measured via diagnostic ultrasound using the on screen caliper tool

primary_outcome.measure: urinary bladder displacement in millimeters during third verbal instruction
primary_outcome.description: bladder displacement will be measured via diagnostic ultrasound using the on screen caliper tool

secondary_outcome.measure: pelvic floor muscles endurance of contraction in seconds
secondary_outcome.description: time of muscle contraction will be measured during the last contraction in each instruction

secondary_outcome.measure: demographic self reported questionnaire regarding height
demographic self reported questionnaire regarding weight
self reported questionnaire regarding physical activity
questionnaire regarding symptoms of urinary incontinence = International Consultation on Incontinence Questionnaire - Short Form
secondary_outcome.description: scale range 0-21 points. higher values represent worse outcome
measured in kg/m^2 and calculated from the reported values of weight and height

arm_group.description: The participants will be verbal instructed to contract the pelvic floor muscle with the following sentences: "squeeze the pelvic floor muscles" "squeeze and lift the pelvic floor muscles as if stopping the flow of urine" "Take a moderate breath in, let the breath out, draw in and lift your pelvic floor." "contract all of the above together"

The participants will be verbal instructed to contract the pelvic floor muscle with the following sentences: "squeeze the pelvic floor muscles" "squeeze the anus" "Take a moderate breath in, let the breath out, draw in and lift your pelvic floor." "contract all of the above together"

intervention.description: Verbal instruction for pelvic floor contraction will be given to participants. Ultrasound examination will be conducted to asses urinary bladder displacement being a marker for pelvic floor muscle function.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- willing to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- previous abdominal surgeries

facility.name: Ariel University, Department of Physical Therapy

clinical_study.keyword: verbal instruction, pelvic diaphragm, muscle contraction

patient_data.ipd_description: the result of the study will be analysed. a paper will be submitted to international journal with study description including methods, examination protocol results.
